summary: This document appears to be a corporate resolution related to the authorization of signers for a corporate account. It lists Jeffrey Epstein and Darren Indyke as authorized signers, detailing their powers and the validity of the resolutions. The document emphasizes that the bank may rely on the instructions of the authorized signers unless notified otherwise.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein is listed as an authorized signer for corporate resolutions, indicating his role in managing corporate accounts.

persons.name: Darren Indyke
persons.context: Darren Indyke is also listed as an authorized signer, suggesting his involvement in corporate matters alongside Epstein.

connections.description: Both individuals are authorized signers for corporate resolutions, indicating a professional relationship in managing corporate affairs.

keyFacts: The document is a corporate resolution dated April 14, 2014.
Jeffrey Epstein and Darren Indyke are named as authorized signers.
The document states that the bank may rely on the instructions of the authorized signers unless notified otherwise.
It emphasizes that no one other than the corporation has any interest in the accounts opened in the corporation's name.
The authorities previously granted to any authorized signer not named in this document are revoked.
